A written and clinical examination as required by the Board.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist shall obtain the education required under paragraph (1) of this subsection from an accredited dental hygiene program.

A dental hygienist who successfully completed the education requirements and examination required under paragraph (1) of this subsection before October 1, 2011, shall take and successfully complete a refresher course and a clinical examination from an accredited dental hygiene program.

subsection.text: There is a State Board of Dental Examiners Fund.

paragraph.text: The Board may set reasonable fees for the issuance and renewal of licenses and its other services.
The fees charged shall be set so as to approximate the cost of maintaining the Board.
Funds to cover the compensation and expenses of the Board members shall be generated by fees set under this section.
The Board shall pay all funds collected under this title to the Comptroller of the State.
The Comptroller shall distribute the fees to the State Board of Dental Examiners Fund.
The Fund shall be used to cover the actual documented direct and indirect costs of fulfilling the statutory and regulatory duties of the Board as provided by the provisions of this article.
The Fund is a continuing, nonlapsing fund, not subject to § 7-302 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
Any unspent portions of the Fund may not be transferred or revert to the General Fund of the State, but shall remain in the Fund to be used for the purposes specified in this article.
No other State money may be used to support the Fund.
In addition to the provisions of subsection (d) of this section, the Board shall fund:

subparagraph.text: The budget of a dental well–being committee, as defined in § 4–501.1 of this title, with fees set, collected, and distributed to the Fund under this title; and
The budget of a dental hygiene well–being committee, as defined in § 4–508 of this title, with fees set, collected, and distributed to the Fund under this title.

paragraph.text: After review and approval by the Board of a budget submitted by the Maryland State Dental Association for a dental well–being committee, the Board may allocate moneys from the Fund to the dental well–being committee.

After review and approval by the Board of a budget submitted by the Maryland Dental Hygienists’ Association for a dental hygiene well–being committee, the Board may allocate moneys from the Fund to a dental hygiene well–being committee.
A designee of the Board shall administer the Fund.
Moneys in the Fund may be expended only for any lawful purpose authorized under the provisions of this article.

subsection.text: The Legislative Auditor shall audit the accounts and transactions of the Fund as provided in § 2-1220 of the State Government Article.

section.text: The Board may sue and be sued in its own name in the courts of this State.

A person shall have the immunity from liability described under § 5-705 of the Courts and Judicial Proceedings Article for giving information to the Board or otherwise participating in its activities.

paragraph.text: Except as otherwise provided in this title, an individual shall be licensed by the Board to practice dentistry before the individual may practice dentistry on a human being in this State.
Except as otherwise provided in this title, an individual shall be licensed by the Board to practice dental hygiene before the individual may practice dental hygiene on a human being in this State.

subsection.text: This section does not apply to:

paragraph.text: A student of dentistry while engaged in an educational program at an approved school of dentistry;
A student of dental hygiene while engaged in an approved educational program in dental hygiene;
A dentist while performing official duties in a federal dental service;
An individual licensed to practice dentistry in any other state or a foreign country, while the individual:

subparagraph.text: Makes a clinical demonstration before a dental society, dental convention, association of dentists, or dental college; or
Performs professional duties on a specific case for which the individual is called into this State; or

paragraph.text: A dental assistant, if the dental assistant:

subparagraph.text: Subject to the rules and regulations adopted by the Board, performs only procedures that do not require the professional skills of a licensed dentist; and
Performs intraoral tasks only under the direct supervision of a licensed dentist who personally is present in the office area where the tasks are performed.

subsection.text: Except as otherwise provided in this title, to qualify for a license, an applicant shall be an individual who meets the requirements of this section.
The applicant shall be of good moral character.
To qualify for a license to practice dentistry, the applicant shall be at least 18 years old.

Unless waived by the Board under §§ 4–303 and 4–303.1 of this subtitle, to qualify for a license to practice dentistry, the applicant shall hold a degree of Doctor of Dental Surgery, Doctor of Dental Medicine, or the equivalent, from a college or university that is:

paragraph.text: Authorized by any state or any province of Canada to grant the degree; and
Recognized by the Board as requiring adequate preprofessional collegiate training and as maintaining an acceptable course of dental instruction.

subsection.text: To qualify for a license to practice dental hygiene, the applicant shall be a graduate of a school for dental hygienists that:

paragraph.text: Requires at least 2 years of education in an institution of higher education;
Is accredited by the American Dental Association Commission on Dental Accreditation; and
Is approved by the Board.

Unless the examination requirement is waived under § 4–306 or § 4–310 of this subtitle, and except as provided in § 4–303.1 of this subtitle, to qualify for a general license to practice dentistry or a general license to practice dental hygiene, the applicant shall pass an examination given by the Board under this subtitle.
An examination is not required for a teacher’s license to practice dentistry, a limited license to practice dentistry, or a teacher’s license to practice dental hygiene.

subsection.text: In addition to the requirements of subsections (a), (b), (c), and (d) of this section, to qualify for a teacher’s license to practice dentistry, the applicant shall:

paragraph.text: Be licensed to practice dentistry in any other state;
Have been active in the dental profession for at least 5 years;
Be a full–time or part–time faculty member at a college or university where the applicant teaches a subject required by the dental school of that college or university; and

If the applicant is engaged in a teaching area that is designated as a specialty by the American Dental Association, meet the requirements established by the American Dental Association for that specialty.

subsection.text: In addition to the requirements of subsections (a), (b), and (e) of this section, to qualify for a teacher’s license to practice dental hygiene, the applicant shall:

paragraph.text: Be licensed to practice dental hygiene in any other state;
Have been active as a dental hygienist for at least 5 years before applying for the teacher’s license to practice dental hygiene; and
Be a full–time or part–time faculty member at a dental school where the applicant teaches a subject required by that school.

subsection.text: In addition to the requirements of subsections (a), (b), (c), and (d) of this section, to qualify for a retired volunteer dentist’s license to practice dentistry, the applicant shall:

paragraph.text: Have had a general license to practice dentistry issued under this title within the last 2 years;
Complete the continuing education requirements that the Board establishes for a general license; and
Provide dental services as required under § 4–308(c) of this subtitle.

subsection.text: In addition to the requirements of subsections (a), (b), and (e) of this section, to qualify for a retired dental hygienist’s license to practice dental hygiene, the applicant shall:

paragraph.text: Have had a general license to practice dental hygiene under this title within the last 2 years;
Complete the continuing education requirements that the Board establishes for a general license; and
Provide dental hygiene services as required under § 4–308(g) of this subtitle.

subsection.text: In addition to the requirements of subsections (a), (b), (c), and (d) of this section, to qualify for a volunteer dentist’s license to practice dentistry, the applicant shall:

paragraph.text: Satisfy the requirements of § 4–306(b)(1) and (d)(2) of this subtitle;
Hold an active license to practice dentistry in another state or in the District of Columbia;
Complete the continuing education requirements that the Board establishes for a general license;
Provide dental services exclusively in the manner described in § 4–308(c) of this subtitle; and
Immediately upon ceasing to provide services exclusively in the manner described in § 4–308(c), surrender the volunteer license to the Board.

subsection.text: In addition to the requirements of subsections (a), (b), (c), and (e) of this section, to qualify for a volunteer dental hygienist’s license to practice dental hygiene, an applicant shall:

paragraph.text: Satisfy the requirements of § 4–306(b)(2) and (e)(2) of this subtitle;
Hold an active license to practice dental hygiene in another state or in the District of Columbia;
Complete the continuing education requirements that the Board establishes for a general license;
Provide dental hygiene services exclusively in the manner described in § 4–308(g) of this subtitle; and
Immediately upon ceasing to provide services exclusively in the manner described in § 4–308(g), surrender the volunteer license to the Board.

subsection.text: To qualify for a limited license to practice dentistry, the applicant shall meet the requirements set forth in subsections (a), (b), (c), and (d) of this section.

Subject to the provisions of this section, the Board may waive the education requirements of § 4-302 of this subtitle for an applicant for a limited license who does not hold a degree of Doctor of Dental Surgery, Doctor of Dental Medicine, or the equivalent from a college or university that is authorized by any state or any province of Canada to grant the degree and is recognized by the Board under § 4-302(d)(2) of this subtitle.
The Board may grant a waiver under this section only if the applicant:

paragraph.text: Completes at least 2 years of formal general clinical training in a college or university that is authorized by any state or any province of Canada to grant the degree of Doctor of Dental Surgery, Doctor of Dental Medicine, or the equivalent and is recognized by the Board under § 4-302(d)(2) of this subtitle; and
Meets any other requirements that the Board establishes for a waiver of the education requirements of § 4-302 of this subtitle.
Notwithstanding the provisions of subsection (b) of this section and § 4-302(g) of this subtitle, the Board may grant a waiver for a teacher’s license if it finds that:

subparagraph.text: The applicant holds a degree of Doctor of Dental Surgery, Doctor of Dental Medicine, or an equivalent degree from a school, college, or faculty of dentistry;
The applicant demonstrates that the applicant has had at least 5 years of clinical dental experience;
The applicant is found to be of good moral character and professionally competent;
The Dean of the University of Maryland Dental School requests the waiver and circumstances exist that justify the granting of a waiver; and
The applicant is appointed to a full-time or part-time faculty position at the University of Maryland Dental School.

paragraph.text: A teacher’s license granted pursuant to a waiver under paragraph (1) of this subsection:

subparagraph.text: Authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry to the same extent as other faculty members who hold general licenses to practice dentistry, provided that the licensee only practices dentistry at established teaching sites and faculty programs of the University of Maryland Dental School; and
Shall be surrendered immediately to the Board when the licensee ceases to hold an appointment as a full-time or part-time faculty member of the University of Maryland Dental School.

subsection.text: Subject to the provisions of this section, the Board may waive the education requirements of § 4-302 of this subtitle for an applicant for a limited license to practice dentistry who does not hold a degree of Doctor of Dental Surgery, Doctor of Dental Medicine, or the equivalent from a college or university that is authorized by any state or any province of Canada to grant the degree and is recognized by the Board under § 4-302(d)(2) of this subtitle.
The Board may grant a waiver under this section only if:

paragraph.text: The applicant:

subparagraph.text: Holds a degree of Doctor of Dental Surgery, Doctor of Dental Medicine, or an equivalent degree from a school, college, or faculty of dentistry other than one located in the United States or Canada;
Has successfully completed at least a 2-year pediatric dentistry residency program at a dental school or a hospital authorized by any state and which is recognized by the Board;
Either is a pediatric dental fellow, or has successfully completed a pediatric dental fellowship, at the University of Maryland Dental School;
Is contractually obligated to provide pediatric dental services for at least 2 years:

sub-subparagraph.text: In a public health dental clinic operated by the State or a county or municipality of the State; or

In a federally qualified health center or Maryland qualified health center only to Medicaid, uninsured, or indigent patients or patients who otherwise qualify for dental care in a public health dental clinic;

subparagraph.text: Limits practice to the public health dental clinic, federally qualified health center, or Maryland qualified health center for which the applicant has contractually agreed to provide pediatric dental services;
Is found to be of good moral character and professionally competent; and
Meets any other requirements that the Board may reasonably require; and

paragraph.text: The health officer of the public health program for which the applicant has contractually agreed to provide at least 2 years of pediatric dental services and the Dean of the University of Maryland Dental School request the waiver from the Board and state that circumstances exist to justify granting the waiver.

subsection.text: A limited license to practice dentistry issued to an applicant for a waiver under this section shall expire and be surrendered immediately to the Board if:

paragraph.text: The licensee’s contract with the public health dental clinic, federally qualified health center, or Maryland qualified health center expires; or
The licensee fails, for any reason, to fully satisfy the licensee’s obligations under subsection (b)(1)(iv) and (v) of this section.

subsection.text: The Board may issue a general license to a limited licensee who was granted a waiver under this section if the limited licensee:

paragraph.text: Successfully completes at least a 2–year contractual obligation to provide pediatric dental care in accordance with subsection (b)(1)(iv) of this section;
Submits an application for a general license to practice dentistry on a form provided by the Board;
Passes the ADLEX as defined in § 4–306(a)(3) of this subtitle;
Passes the Maryland Dental Jurisprudence Examination given by the Board or its designee;
Passes the National Board Examinations;

Demonstrates oral English competency by scoring 220 or better for overall comprehension and 2.0 or better for pronunciation, grammar, and fluency on the test of spoken English administered by the Educational Testing Service; and
Is found to be of good moral character.

subsection.text: To apply for a license, an applicant shall:

paragraph.text: Submit an application to the Board on the form that the Board requires; and
Pay to the Board an application fee set by the Board.

subsection.text: In addition to the other requirements of this section, an applicant for a limited license to practice dentistry shall submit to the Board a written request, from the hospital, sanatorium, dental school, or public health program to which the practice is to be limited, that the license be issued.
To apply for a retired volunteer dentist’s license, a volunteer dentist’s license, or a temporary volunteer dentist’s license to practice dentistry, an applicant:

paragraph.text: Shall submit an application to the Board on the form that the Board requires; and
May not be required to pay an application fee.
At least 30 days before the examination, an applicant for a general license to practice dental hygiene shall submit the application to the Board.
In addition to the other requirements of this section, an applicant for a license to practice dental hygiene shall submit to the Board:

subparagraph.text: Satisfactory evidence of graduation from a dental hygiene program accredited by the American Dental Association Commission on Dental Accreditation; and
Any other credentials that the Board requires.

subsection.text: To apply for a retired volunteer dental hygienist’s license, a volunteer dental hygienist’s license, or a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license to practice dental hygiene, an applicant:

paragraph.text: Shall submit an application to the Board on the form that the Board requires; and
May not be required to pay an application fee.

subsection.text: To apply for a temporary dental clinic permit, an applicant:

paragraph.text: Shall submit an application on the form that the Board requires; and
May not be required to pay an application fee.

subsection.text: An applicant who otherwise qualifies for a general license to practice dentistry or a general license to practice dental hygiene is entitled to be examined as provided in this section.
The Board shall notify each qualified applicant of the time and place of examination.
The Board shall determine the subjects, scope, form, and passing score for examinations given under this title.
An applicant shall pay:

paragraph.text: To the Board an examination fee set by the Board in an amount that does not exceed the costs of administering the examination; or
To an examining body designated by the Board an examination fee set by the examining body as approved by the Board.

subsection.text: An applicant who fails an examination 4 times may not be licensed.
Consumer members of the Board may only participate in the proctoring or monitoring of examinations under this title.
Unless authorized by the Board, a dental hygienist member of the Board may not participate in any activity relating to the examination of dentists under this title.

paragraph.text: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
“ADEX” means the American Board of Dental Examiners, Inc., or its successor organization.

subparagraph.text: “ADLEX” means the American Dental Licensing Examination designed and developed by ADEX, or its successor examination.
“ADLEX” includes a written component and a clinical component.
“ADHLEX” means the American Dental Hygiene Licensing Examination designed and developed by ADEX, or its successor examination.
“ADHLEX” includes a written component and a clinical component.

paragraph.text: A dentist licensed in any other state shall be issued a license in this State if the applicant:

sub-subparagraph.text: Has passed the ADLEX; and
Has passed the Maryland Dental Jurisprudence Examination given by the Board or its designee; or
For the 5 preceding years, has been actively engaged in practicing dentistry for at least 850 hours on average per year;
Has passed an examination with a clinical component as a requirement for licensure in another state;
Has passed a comprehensive written examination on applied clinical diagnosis and treatment planning administered by ADEX; and
Has passed the Maryland Dental Jurisprudence Examination given by the Board or its designee.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist licensed in any other state shall be issued a license in this State if the applicant:

sub-subparagraph.text: Has passed the ADHLEX; and
Has passed the Maryland Dental Hygiene Jurisprudence Examination given by the Board or its designee; or
For the 3 preceding years, has been actively engaged in practicing dental hygiene for at least 150 hours on average per year;
Has passed an examination with a clinical component as a requirement for licensure in another state;
Has passed a comprehensive written examination on applied clinical diagnosis and treatment planning administered by ADEX; and
Has passed the Maryland Dental Hygiene Jurisprudence Examination given by the Board or its designee.

paragraph.text: The Board may adopt regulations for the content and administration of examinations and any other regulations necessary to provide for the licensure of individuals who apply for a license to practice dentistry under subsection (b)(1) of this section.

The Board may adopt regulations for the content and administration of examinations and any other regulations necessary to provide for the licensure of individuals who apply for a license to practice dental hygiene under subsection (b)(2) of this section.

subsection.text: An applicant for a general license to practice dentistry under this section shall:

paragraph.text: Pay the application fee required by § 4–304 of this subtitle; and
Provide adequate evidence that the applicant:

subparagraph.text: Meets the qualifications otherwise required by this title for a general license to practice dentistry;
Holds a license to practice dentistry in another state;
Has satisfied the examination requirements provided in subsection (b)(1) of this section;

Is not being investigated by a disciplinary authority of another state, does not have charges pending against the applicant’s license, and has not been disciplined by a disciplinary or licensing authority of any other state or country, or been convicted or disciplined by a court of any state or country for an act that would be grounds for disciplinary action under § 4–315 of this subtitle; and
Has not previously failed an examination for licensure as a dentist in this State.

subsection.text: An applicant for a general license to practice dental hygiene under this section shall:

paragraph.text: Pay the application fee required by § 4–304 of this subtitle; and
Provide adequate evidence that the applicant:

subparagraph.text: Meets the qualifications otherwise required by this title for a general license to practice dental hygiene;
Holds a license to practice dental hygiene in another state;
Has satisfied the examination requirements provided in subsection (b)(2) of this section;

Is not being investigated by a disciplinary authority of another state, does not have charges pending against the applicant’s license, and has not been disciplined by a disciplinary or licensing authority of any other state or country, or been convicted or disciplined by a court of any state or country for an act that would be grounds for disciplinary action under § 4–315 of this subtitle; and
Has not previously failed an examination for licensure as a dental hygienist in this State.

subsection.text: The Board shall issue the appropriate license to any applicant who meets the requirements of this title for that license.

paragraph.text: The Board shall include on each license that the Board issues:

subparagraph.text: The name of the licensee;
The date the license was issued;
A serial number;
The signatures of the president and secretary of the Board; and
The seal of the Board.

paragraph.text: On a limited license to practice dentistry, the Board also shall include:

subparagraph.text: The date the license expires, for a license that expires on the first anniversary of its effective date; and
The name of the institution or public health program at which the licensee is authorized to practice dentistry.

paragraph.text: On a teacher’s license to practice dentistry, the Board also shall include the name of the college or university at which the licensee is a full-time or part-time faculty member.
On a teacher’s license to practice dental hygiene, the Board also shall include the name of the dental school at which the licensee is a full-time or part-time faculty member.

subsection.text: The Board shall issue a license to replace a lost or destroyed license if the licensee pays a fee set by the Board that approximates the actual cost of replacing the license.
A general license to practice dentistry issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry while the license is effective.
While it is effective, a limited license to practice dentistry issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry, including as an intern or a resident:

paragraph.text: Only for the institution or public health program named on the license; and
Only on patients of the institution or public health program named on the license.

subsection.text: While it is effective, a retired volunteer dentist’s license or a volunteer dentist’s license to practice dentistry issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry:

paragraph.text: Only in a dental office, dental clinic, ambulatory care facility, or hospital;
Only for an entity providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or disabled that is operated by:

subparagraph.text: The State or a local government;
A bona fide charitable organization; or
Any other entity authorized under regulations adopted by the Board;

paragraph.text: If the dentist signs a written statement agreeing to donate at least 100 hours of dental services without compensation in a facility that satisfies the requirements of items (1) and (2) of this subsection;
If the dentist provides documentation as required by the Board which evidences that the licensee is covered by malpractice insurance; and
If the dentist does not otherwise practice dentistry for profit in Maryland.
While it is effective, a temporary volunteer dentist’s license issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry:

subparagraph.text: Only in a temporary dental clinic providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or disabled that is operated by:

sub-subparagraph.text: A bona fide charitable organization;
The State or a local government; or
A local health department;

subparagraph.text: If:

sub-subparagraph.text: The dentist holds a general license to practice dentistry in another state that permits clinical practice and the dentist is not subject to clinical restrictions; and
The dentist has:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: Passed the North East Regional Board Clinical Examination; or

Submitted to the Board a notarized affidavit or other evidence satisfactory to the Board indicating that for the 5 years preceding application, the applicant has actively engaged in practicing dentistry for at least 850 hours on average per year;

subparagraph.text: If the dentist has fulfilled any requirements of the Board relating to knowledge of the regulations adopted by the Board and the laws concerning the practice of dentistry in the State;

If the dentist provides a notarized affidavit to the Board agreeing to donate dental services without compensation for a temporary dental clinic that satisfies the requirements of subsection (i) of this section;
If the dentist provides documentation as required by the Board that evidences that the dentist is covered by malpractice insurance;
If the dentist does not otherwise practice dentistry for profit in the State; and
If the dentist provides verification of current cardiopulmonary resuscitation certification.

paragraph.text: A dentist who holds a temporary volunteer dentist’s license may not administer, maintain, or monitor general anesthesia or sedation.
A dentist who holds a temporary volunteer dentist’s license may only provide services authorized under the Maryland Dentistry Act and the regulations adopted by the Board.

A dentist who holds a temporary volunteer dentist’s license or the temporary dental clinic in which the dentist is providing services shall provide a form to a patient at the conclusion of treatment that contains:

subparagraph.text: A summary of the services that were provided to the patient by the dentist and, if applicable, the dental hygienist; and
Instructions for any recommended follow–up dental care.

paragraph.text: The Board may deny a temporary volunteer dentist’s license on the grounds provided under § 4–315 of this subtitle.
A temporary volunteer dentist’s license issued to a dentist under this title shall be issued for the duration of the temporary dental clinic only and may not be renewed.

The Board may issue a temporary volunteer dentist’s license to a dentist who previously held a temporary volunteer dentist’s license if the dentist applies for a new license and satisfies the requirements of this subtitle.
The Board may not require continuing education as a condition for the issuance of a temporary volunteer dentist’s license.

subsection.text: While it is effective, a teacher’s license to practice dentistry issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry at only the following institutions:

paragraph.text: The institution named on the license; and
Other affiliated institutions as appropriate because of the specialized nature of the services to be performed.
Except as provided in subsection (k) of this section, while it is effective, a general license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene:

subparagraph.text: Under the supervision of a licensed dentist who is:

sub-subparagraph.text: On the premises and available for personal consultation while the services are being performed; or
Not on the premises while authorized dental hygiene services are provided when the requirements of subsection (l) of this section have been fully satisfied; and

subparagraph.text: Only in a:

sub-subparagraph.text: Dental office;
Dental clinic;
Hospital;
School;
Charitable institution; or
Health maintenance organization certified by the State Insurance Commissioner.

subparagraph.text: The Board may waive, on a case by case basis only, the supervision requirements of this subsection for:

sub-subparagraph.text: A dental facility owned and operated by the federal, the State, or a local government;
A health facility licensed by the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene;
A facility providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or handicapped that is owned and operated by:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: The State or a local government; or
A bona fide charitable organization; or

sub-subparagraph.text: Any other setting authorized under regulations adopted by the Board.

subparagraph.text: A waiver is not required to practice dental hygiene under general supervision in accordance with subsection (k) of this section.

paragraph.text: The Board may grant a waiver under paragraph (2) of this subsection if:

subparagraph.text: The facility requesting the waiver has submitted a written application;
The facility requesting the waiver has submitted a medical emergency plan of action at the time of application; and
The Board finds that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Good cause exists to justify the granting of the waiver;
Adequate facilities and equipment, including portable equipment where appropriate and appropriate armamentarium, are available for the appropriate delivery of dental hygiene services; and
Adequate safeguards are present to protect the patient’s health and safety.

subparagraph.text: The Board, upon written request or its own motion, may conduct a public informational meeting on any waiver application.
The Board shall maintain records of all waiver applications and the criteria and basis for its action on each application.
The Board shall have the power to inspect or review any facility, location, person, or entity applying for, covered by, or acting under a waiver.

Except as provided under subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, the Board shall accept or deny a waiver under paragraph (2) of this subsection within 60 calendar days of the receipt of the application for the waiver or it shall be deemed to have been accepted.

If extraordinary circumstances exist, the Board shall accept or deny a waiver under paragraph (2) of this subsection within 90 calendar days of the receipt of the application for the waiver or it shall be deemed to have been accepted.

paragraph.text: Any changes in the procedures or personnel of a facility with a waiver granted under this subsection shall be reported to the Board within 15 business days after the change.

subsection.text: While it is effective, a retired volunteer dental hygienist’s license or a volunteer dental hygienist’s license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene:

paragraph.text: Only in a dental office, dental clinic, ambulatory care facility, or hospital;
Only for an entity providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or handicapped that is operated by:

subparagraph.text: The State or a local government;
A bona fide charitable organization; or
Any other entity authorized under regulations adopted by the Board;

paragraph.text: If the dental hygienist signs a written statement agreeing to donate at least 100 hours of dental hygiene services without compensation in a facility that satisfies the requirements of items (1) and (2) of this subsection;
If the dental hygienist provides documentation as required by the Board which evidences that the licensee is covered by malpractice insurance; and
If the dental hygienist does not otherwise practice dental hygiene for profit in Maryland.
While it is effective, a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene:

subparagraph.text: Only in a temporary dental clinic providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or disabled that is operated by:

sub-subparagraph.text: A bona fide charitable organization;
The State or a local government; or
A local health department;

subparagraph.text: If the dental hygienist holds a general license to practice dental hygiene in another state that permits clinical practice and the dental hygienist is not subject to clinical restrictions;
In addition to holding a general license to practice dental hygiene, if the dental hygienist:

sub-subparagraph.text: Provides documentation as required by the Board which evidences that the dental hygienist passed the North East Regional Board Clinical Examination; or

Submits to the Board a notarized affidavit or other evidence satisfactory to the Board indicating that for the 3 years preceding application, the dental hygienist has actively engaged in practicing dental hygiene for at least 150 hours on average per year;

subparagraph.text: If the dental hygienist has fulfilled any requirements of the Board related to knowledge of the laws and regulations governing the practice of dental hygiene in the State;

If the dental hygienist provides a notarized affidavit to the Board agreeing to donate dental hygiene services without compensation for a temporary dental clinic that satisfies the requirements of subsection (i) of this section;
If the dental hygienist provides documentation as required by the Board evidencing that the dental hygienist is covered by malpractice insurance;
If the dental hygienist does not otherwise practice dental hygiene for profit in the State; and
If the dental hygienist provides verification of current cardiopulmonary resuscitation certification.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist who holds a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license may only provide services authorized under the Maryland Dentistry Act and the regulations adopted by the Board.
A dental hygienist who holds a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license may not:

subparagraph.text: Administer local anesthesia; or
Administer, maintain, or monitor nitrous oxide oxygen.

paragraph.text: While it is effective, a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene under the general supervision of a dentist who:

subparagraph.text: Is on the premises;
Examines the patient at any time during the treatment; and
Is available for personal consultation while the services are being performed.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist may perform an assessment of dental needs and provide dental hygiene services prior to an examination by a supervising dentist.
This subsection may not be construed to:

subparagraph.text: Require a preliminary dental examination or treatment by a dental hygienist; or
Prohibit a supervising dentist from either examining a patient or providing treatment to a patient prior to treatment by a dental hygienist.

paragraph.text: The Board may deny a temporary volunteer license to practice dental hygiene on the grounds provided under § 4–315 of this subtitle.
A temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license issued to a dental hygienist under this section shall be issued for the duration of the temporary dental clinic only and may not be renewed.

The Board may issue a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license to a dental hygienist who previously held a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license if the dental hygienist applies for a new license and satisfies the requirements of this subtitle.
The Board may not require continuing education as a condition for the issuance of a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license.

While it is effective, a temporary dental clinic permit issued to a bona fide charitable organization under this title authorizes the permit holder to utilize holders of a temporary volunteer dentist’s license or a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license to provide dental services to the poor, elderly, or disabled at a temporary dental clinic that is operated by the bona fide charitable organization.
The Board shall issue a temporary dental clinic permit to a bona fide charitable organization that meets the requirements of this subsection.
A temporary dental clinic permit issued to a bona fide charitable organization under this title shall be issued for the duration of the dental clinic only and may not be renewed.

The Board may issue a temporary dental clinic permit to a bona fide charitable organization that previously held a temporary dental clinic permit if the bona fide charitable organization applies for a new permit and satisfies the requirements of this subtitle.
A bona fide charitable organization that conducts a temporary dental clinic under this title may not be construed to be practicing dentistry as defined in § 4–101 of this title.

subparagraph.text: The State, a local government, or a local health department that provides dental services to the poor, elderly, or disabled:

sub-subparagraph.text: May not be required by the Board to seek authorization under this title to provide the services; and
Shall provide written notice to the Board of its intention to provide dental services to the poor, elderly, or disabled at least 60 days prior to the date the services are to be provided.

subparagraph.text: A holder of an out–of–state license to practice dentistry or dental hygiene who would like to provide dental services sponsored by the State, a local government, or a local health department shall obtain a temporary volunteer dentist’s license or temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license as provided in this title before providing the dental services.

paragraph.text: A holder of a temporary dental clinic permit shall have:

subparagraph.text: A medical emergency plan;
Adequate equipment, including portable equipment where appropriate, and appropriate armamentarium available for the appropriate delivery of dental services; and
Adequate safeguards to protect the health and safety of patients.

paragraph.text: The Board may:

subparagraph.text: Enter and inspect a temporary dental clinic in order to carry out a duty under this title; and

Conduct an investigation of a temporary dental clinic or a holder of a temporary volunteer dentist’s license or a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license providing dental services at the temporary dental clinic.

subsection.text: While it is effective, a teacher’s license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to:

paragraph.text: Teach dental hygiene only at the institution named on the license; and
Practice dental hygiene under the general supervision of a licensed dentist with the institution named on the license.

subparagraph.text: In this subsection the following words have the meanings indicated.

“Contractual employee” means a dental hygienist who has an annual contract to practice dental hygiene an average of at least 8 hours per week in a facility specified under paragraph (3)(i) of this subsection.
“Facility” includes a program operated within a facility that is specified under paragraph (3)(i) of this subsection.
“Federally qualified health center” has the meaning stated in 42 U.S.C. § 254b(a).
“Federally qualified health center look–alike” has the meaning stated in 42 U.S.C. § 1396d(l)(2)(B).
“General supervision” means supervision of a dental hygienist by a dentist, where the dentist may or may not be present when the dental hygienist performs the dental hygiene procedures.

While effective, a general license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene and apply sealants or fluoride agents such as professional topical fluoride treatments, mouth rinse, or varnish:

sub-subparagraph.text: Under general supervision in accordance with this subsection; and
In a facility specified under paragraph (3)(i) of this subsection that complies with the requirements of this subsection.

subparagraph.text: This subsection may not be construed to:

sub-subparagraph.text: Authorize a dental hygienist to practice dental hygiene independent of a supervising dentist;
Prohibit a dentist from being available for personal consultation or on the premises where a dental hygienist is practicing; or
Require a waiver under subsection (f) of this section.

subparagraph.text: While it is effective, a general license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene under general supervision in:

sub-subparagraph.text: A dental facility owned and operated by the federal, the State, or a local government;
A public health department or public school of the State or a county;
A facility in which a program licensed by the Department is operating;
A facility owned and operated by the Department of Juvenile Services;
A facility owned and operated by the State or a local government that provides medical care to the poor, elderly, or handicapped;
A facility in which a federally qualified health center or a federally qualified health center look–alike is located; or
A facility in which a State licensed Head Start Program or Early Head Start Program operates.

subparagraph.text: Before a facility may allow a dental hygienist authorized to practice dental hygiene under general supervision in accordance with this subsection to practice in the facility, the facility shall report to the Board:

sub-subparagraph.text: That the facility is operating under general supervision; and
The identity of each supervising dentist and each dental hygienist.

paragraph.text: A facility in which a dental hygienist is authorized to practice under the general supervision of a licensed dentist in accordance with this subsection shall ensure that:

subparagraph.text: The supervising dentist for the facility:

sub-subparagraph.text: Holds an active general license to practice dentistry in the State;
Holds a current certificate evidencing health provider level C proficiency, or its equivalent, in cardiopulmonary resuscitation; and
Has at least 2 years of active clinical practice in direct patient care;

subparagraph.text: Each dental hygienist authorized to practice under the general supervision of a licensed dentist in accordance with this subsection:

sub-subparagraph.text: Holds an active general license to practice dental hygiene in the State;
Holds a current certificate evidencing health provider level C proficiency, or its equivalent, in cardiopulmonary resuscitation;
Has at least 2 years of active clinical practice in direct patient care; and
Is a permanent or contractual employee of the federal government, a state or local government, or a federally qualified health center;

subparagraph.text: The facility has:

sub-subparagraph.text: A medical emergency plan;
Adequate equipment, including portable equipment where appropriate and appropriate armamentarium, available for the appropriate delivery of dental hygiene services; and
Adequate safeguards to protect the patient’s health and safety;

subparagraph.text: A recall patient who has been examined by a dental hygienist practicing under the general supervision of a licensed dentist will be scheduled for an oral examination every 6 months, or as otherwise recommended by the supervising dentist;
A dental hygienist practicing under the general supervision of a licensed dentist ascertains before treating a recall patient that there has been no change in the patient’s medical history;
A dental hygienist consults with the supervising dentist, the patient’s dentist, or a treating physician before proceeding with treatment if there is a change in the patient’s medical history;
Adequate facilities and equipment are available for the delivery of dental hygiene services other than fluoride rinse programs; and
The facility reports to the Board any changes in the status of the facility’s general supervision, any supervising dentist, or any dental hygienist within 30 days after the change.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, “private dental office” means a dental office owned and operated by:

subparagraph.text: A licensed dentist; or
A professional corporation, partnership, limited liability company, or limited liability partnership owned and controlled by a licensed dentist.

paragraph.text: While it is effective, a general license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene under the general supervision of a licensed dentist in a private dental office.
A private dental office in which a dental hygienist is authorized to practice under the general supervision of a licensed dentist shall ensure that:

subparagraph.text: The supervising dentist holds an active license to practice dentistry in this State;
The dental hygienist holds an active license to practice dental hygiene in this State;
The dental hygienist has at least 1,500 hours of dental hygiene clinical practice in direct patient care; and

There is a written agreement between the supervising dentist and the dental hygienist practicing under general supervision that clearly sets forth the terms and conditions under which the dental hygienist may practice, including a statement that the dental hygienist may provide dental hygiene services without the supervising dentist on the premises.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist may perform authorized dental hygiene services without the supervising dentist on the premises only if:

subparagraph.text: After the supervising dentist examines and evaluates a patient, the prescribed and authorized treatment to be provided by the dental hygienist is written in the patient’s records;

sub-subparagraph.text: Treatments authorized by a supervising dentist to be provided by the dental hygienist are rendered no later than 7 months from the date the patient was examined and evaluated by the supervising dentist; and
Upon expiration of a prescription or prescribed treatment, the supervising dentist examines and reevaluates the patient before writing a new prescription and authorization for treatment;

subparagraph.text: Prior to an appointment, the patient or the custodial parent or legal guardian of a minor or incompetent adult shall:

sub-subparagraph.text: Be informed that a dental hygienist will be providing services previously prescribed by a dentist who will not be on the premises during the appointment; and
Consent to receiving the dental hygiene services;

subparagraph.text: Written emergency procedures are in place and the dental hygienist is trained to implement the emergency procedures;
A designated licensed dentist is available for consultation with the dental hygienist; and

The number of unsupervised clinical hours worked by a supervised dental hygienist in any given 3–month period is less than 60 percent of the dental hygienist’s total hours worked during that 3–month period.

paragraph.text: A supervising dentist may not employ more than two dental hygienists to work under the dentist’s general supervision at any given time.

subparagraph.text: In this subsection the following words have the meanings indicated.
“Assisted living program” has the meaning stated in § 19–1801 of the Health – General Article.
“General supervision” means supervision of a dental hygienist by a dentist, where the dentist may or may not be present when the dental hygienist performs the dental hygiene procedures.
“Long–term care facility” means:

sub-subparagraph.text: A nursing home; or
An assisted living program.

subparagraph.text: “Nursing home” has the meaning stated in § 19–1401 of the Health – General Article.

While it is effective, a general license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene under the general supervision of a licensed dentist in a long–term care facility in accordance with this subsection.
This subsection may not be construed to:

sub-subparagraph.text: Authorize a dental hygienist to practice dental hygiene independent of a supervising dentist;
Prohibit a dentist from being available for personal consultation or on the premises where a dental hygienist is practicing;
Prohibit a dental hygienist, without the supervision of a dentist, from performing a preliminary dental examination with subsequent referral to a dentist; or
Require a waiver under subsection (f) of this section.

paragraph.text: Before a dental hygienist is authorized to practice dental hygiene under general supervision in a long–term care facility in accordance with this subsection, the dental hygienist shall:

subparagraph.text: Hold an active license to practice dental hygiene in the State;
Hold a current certificate evidencing health provider level C proficiency, or its equivalent, in cardiopulmonary resuscitation;
Have at least 2 years of active clinical practice in direct patient care; and
Ensure that the long–term care facility where the dental hygienist will practice under general supervision has:

sub-subparagraph.text: A written medical emergency plan in place;
Adequate equipment, including portable equipment and appropriate armamentarium, available for the appropriate delivery of dental hygiene services; and
Adequate safeguards to protect the patient’s health and safety.

paragraph.text: Before a dental hygienist is authorized to practice dental hygiene under general supervision in a long–term care facility in accordance with this subsection, the supervising dentist shall:

subparagraph.text: Hold an active general license to practice dentistry in the State;
Hold a current certificate evidencing health provider level C proficiency, or its equivalent, in cardiopulmonary resuscitation; and
Have at least 2 years of active clinical practice in direct patient care.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist practicing under the general supervision of a licensed dentist in a long–term care facility and performing an authorized dental hygiene service for a patient’s initial appointment shall:

subparagraph.text: Have a written agreement between the supervising dentist and the dental hygienist that clearly sets forth the terms and conditions under which the dental hygienist may practice, including a statement that the dental hygienist may provide dental hygiene services without the supervising dentist on the premises;
Ensure that the supervising dentist is available for consultation with the dental hygienist:

sub-subparagraph.text: In person;
By telephone; or
Electronically;

subparagraph.text: Consult with the supervising dentist or a treating physician before proceeding with initial treatment if there is a change in a recall patient’s medical history;
Assess the appropriate recall interval based on the individual needs of the patient, or as otherwise recommended by the supervising dentist;
Limit dental hygiene tasks and procedures to:

sub-subparagraph.text: Toothbrush prophylaxis;
Application of fluoride;
Dental hygiene instruction;
Assessment of the patient’s apparent need for further evaluation by a dentist in order to diagnose the presence of dental disease; and
Other duties as may be delegated, verbally or in writing, by the supervising dentist; and

subparagraph.text: Submit findings of the initial assessment to the supervising dentist for a determination of future treatment.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist may perform subsequent authorized dental hygiene services without the supervising dentist on the premises only if:

subparagraph.text: The supervising dentist examines the patient and authorizes in the patient’s record a prescription of specific treatment to be provided by the dental hygienist;
An authorized treatment is provided by the dental hygienist as soon as possible, but no later than 7 months from the date the patient was examined by the supervising dentist; and
Upon expiration of a prescribed treatment, the supervising dentist is responsible for determining future protocols for the treatment of the patient.

subsection.text: A general license to practice dentistry issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry while the license is effective.
While it is effective, a limited license to practice dentistry issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry, including as an intern or a resident:

paragraph.text: Only for the institution or public health program named on the license; and
Only on patients of the institution or public health program named on the license.

subsection.text: While it is effective, a retired volunteer dentist’s license or a volunteer dentist’s license to practice dentistry issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry:

paragraph.text: Only in a dental office, dental clinic, ambulatory care facility, or hospital;
Only for an entity providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or disabled that is operated by:

subparagraph.text: The State or a local government;
A bona fide charitable organization; or
Any other entity authorized under regulations adopted by the Board;

paragraph.text: If the dentist signs a written statement agreeing to donate at least 100 hours of dental services without compensation in a facility that satisfies the requirements of items (1) and (2) of this subsection;
If the dentist provides documentation as required by the Board which evidences that the licensee is covered by malpractice insurance; and
If the dentist does not otherwise practice dentistry for profit in Maryland.
While it is effective, a temporary volunteer dentist’s license issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry:

subparagraph.text: Only in a temporary dental clinic providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or disabled that is operated by:

sub-subparagraph.text: A bona fide charitable organization;
The State or a local government; or
A local health department;

subparagraph.text: If:

sub-subparagraph.text: The dentist holds a general license to practice dentistry in another state that permits clinical practice and the dentist is not subject to clinical restrictions; and
The dentist has:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: Passed the North East Regional Board Clinical Examination; or

Submitted to the Board a notarized affidavit or other evidence satisfactory to the Board indicating that for the 5 years preceding application, the applicant has actively engaged in practicing dentistry for at least 850 hours on average per year;

subparagraph.text: If the dentist has fulfilled any requirements of the Board relating to knowledge of the regulations adopted by the Board and the laws concerning the practice of dentistry in the State;

If the dentist provides a notarized affidavit to the Board agreeing to donate dental services without compensation for a temporary dental clinic that satisfies the requirements of subsection (i) of this section;
If the dentist provides documentation as required by the Board that evidences that the dentist is covered by malpractice insurance;
If the dentist does not otherwise practice dentistry for profit in the State; and
If the dentist provides verification of current cardiopulmonary resuscitation certification.

paragraph.text: A dentist who holds a temporary volunteer dentist’s license may not administer, maintain, or monitor general anesthesia or sedation.
A dentist who holds a temporary volunteer dentist’s license may only provide services authorized under the Maryland Dentistry Act and the regulations adopted by the Board.

A dentist who holds a temporary volunteer dentist’s license or the temporary dental clinic in which the dentist is providing services shall provide a form to a patient at the conclusion of treatment that contains:

subparagraph.text: A summary of the services that were provided to the patient by the dentist and, if applicable, the dental hygienist; and
Instructions for any recommended follow–up dental care.

paragraph.text: The Board may deny a temporary volunteer dentist’s license on the grounds provided under § 4–315 of this subtitle.
A temporary volunteer dentist’s license issued to a dentist under this title shall be issued for the duration of the temporary dental clinic only and may not be renewed.

The Board may issue a temporary volunteer dentist’s license to a dentist who previously held a temporary volunteer dentist’s license if the dentist applies for a new license and satisfies the requirements of this subtitle.
The Board may not require continuing education as a condition for the issuance of a temporary volunteer dentist’s license.

subsection.text: While it is effective, a teacher’s license to practice dentistry issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dentistry at only the following institutions:

paragraph.text: The institution named on the license; and
Other affiliated institutions as appropriate because of the specialized nature of the services to be performed.
Except as provided in subsection (k) of this section, while it is effective, a general license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene:

subparagraph.text: Under the supervision of a licensed dentist who is:

sub-subparagraph.text: On the premises and available for personal consultation while the services are being performed; or
Not on the premises while authorized dental hygiene services are provided when the requirements of subsection (l) of this section have been fully satisfied; and

subparagraph.text: Only in a:

sub-subparagraph.text: Dental office;
Dental clinic;
Hospital;
School;
Charitable institution; or
Health maintenance organization certified by the State Insurance Commissioner.

subparagraph.text: The Board may waive, on a case by case basis only, the supervision requirements of this subsection for:

sub-subparagraph.text: A dental facility owned and operated by the federal, the State, or a local government;
A health facility licensed by the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene;
A facility providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or handicapped that is owned and operated by:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: The State or a local government; or
A bona fide charitable organization; or

sub-subparagraph.text: Any other setting authorized under regulations adopted by the Board.

subparagraph.text: A waiver is not required to practice dental hygiene under general supervision in accordance with subsection (k) of this section.

paragraph.text: The Board may grant a waiver under paragraph (2) of this subsection if:

subparagraph.text: The facility requesting the waiver has submitted a written application;
The facility requesting the waiver has submitted a medical emergency plan of action at the time of application; and
The Board finds that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Good cause exists to justify the granting of the waiver;
Adequate facilities and equipment, including portable equipment where appropriate and appropriate armamentarium, are available for the appropriate delivery of dental hygiene services; and
Adequate safeguards are present to protect the patient’s health and safety.

subparagraph.text: The Board, upon written request or its own motion, may conduct a public informational meeting on any waiver application.
The Board shall maintain records of all waiver applications and the criteria and basis for its action on each application.
The Board shall have the power to inspect or review any facility, location, person, or entity applying for, covered by, or acting under a waiver.

Except as provided under subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, the Board shall accept or deny a waiver under paragraph (2) of this subsection within 60 calendar days of the receipt of the application for the waiver or it shall be deemed to have been accepted.

If extraordinary circumstances exist, the Board shall accept or deny a waiver under paragraph (2) of this subsection within 90 calendar days of the receipt of the application for the waiver or it shall be deemed to have been accepted.

paragraph.text: Any changes in the procedures or personnel of a facility with a waiver granted under this subsection shall be reported to the Board within 15 business days after the change.

subsection.text: While it is effective, a retired volunteer dental hygienist’s license or a volunteer dental hygienist’s license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene:

paragraph.text: Only in a dental office, dental clinic, ambulatory care facility, or hospital;
Only for an entity providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or handicapped that is operated by:

subparagraph.text: The State or a local government;
A bona fide charitable organization; or
Any other entity authorized under regulations adopted by the Board;

paragraph.text: If the dental hygienist signs a written statement agreeing to donate at least 100 hours of dental hygiene services without compensation in a facility that satisfies the requirements of items (1) and (2) of this subsection;
If the dental hygienist provides documentation as required by the Board which evidences that the licensee is covered by malpractice insurance; and
If the dental hygienist does not otherwise practice dental hygiene for profit in Maryland.
While it is effective, a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene:

subparagraph.text: Only in a temporary dental clinic providing medical care to the poor, elderly, or disabled that is operated by:

sub-subparagraph.text: A bona fide charitable organization;
The State or a local government; or
A local health department;

subparagraph.text: If the dental hygienist holds a general license to practice dental hygiene in another state that permits clinical practice and the dental hygienist is not subject to clinical restrictions;
In addition to holding a general license to practice dental hygiene, if the dental hygienist:

sub-subparagraph.text: Provides documentation as required by the Board which evidences that the dental hygienist passed the North East Regional Board Clinical Examination; or

Submits to the Board a notarized affidavit or other evidence satisfactory to the Board indicating that for the 3 years preceding application, the dental hygienist has actively engaged in practicing dental hygiene for at least 150 hours on average per year;

subparagraph.text: If the dental hygienist has fulfilled any requirements of the Board related to knowledge of the laws and regulations governing the practice of dental hygiene in the State;

If the dental hygienist provides a notarized affidavit to the Board agreeing to donate dental hygiene services without compensation for a temporary dental clinic that satisfies the requirements of subsection (i) of this section;
If the dental hygienist provides documentation as required by the Board evidencing that the dental hygienist is covered by malpractice insurance;
If the dental hygienist does not otherwise practice dental hygiene for profit in the State; and
If the dental hygienist provides verification of current cardiopulmonary resuscitation certification.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist who holds a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license may only provide services authorized under the Maryland Dentistry Act and the regulations adopted by the Board.
A dental hygienist who holds a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license may not:

subparagraph.text: Administer local anesthesia; or
Administer, maintain, or monitor nitrous oxide oxygen.

paragraph.text: While it is effective, a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene under the general supervision of a dentist who:

subparagraph.text: Is on the premises;
Examines the patient at any time during the treatment; and
Is available for personal consultation while the services are being performed.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist may perform an assessment of dental needs and provide dental hygiene services prior to an examination by a supervising dentist.
This subsection may not be construed to:

subparagraph.text: Require a preliminary dental examination or treatment by a dental hygienist; or
Prohibit a supervising dentist from either examining a patient or providing treatment to a patient prior to treatment by a dental hygienist.

paragraph.text: The Board may deny a temporary volunteer license to practice dental hygiene on the grounds provided under § 4–315 of this subtitle.
A temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license issued to a dental hygienist under this section shall be issued for the duration of the temporary dental clinic only and may not be renewed.

The Board may issue a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license to a dental hygienist who previously held a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license if the dental hygienist applies for a new license and satisfies the requirements of this subtitle.
The Board may not require continuing education as a condition for the issuance of a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license.

While it is effective, a temporary dental clinic permit issued to a bona fide charitable organization under this title authorizes the permit holder to utilize holders of a temporary volunteer dentist’s license or a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license to provide dental services to the poor, elderly, or disabled at a temporary dental clinic that is operated by the bona fide charitable organization.
The Board shall issue a temporary dental clinic permit to a bona fide charitable organization that meets the requirements of this subsection.
A temporary dental clinic permit issued to a bona fide charitable organization under this title shall be issued for the duration of the dental clinic only and may not be renewed.

The Board may issue a temporary dental clinic permit to a bona fide charitable organization that previously held a temporary dental clinic permit if the bona fide charitable organization applies for a new permit and satisfies the requirements of this subtitle.
A bona fide charitable organization that conducts a temporary dental clinic under this title may not be construed to be practicing dentistry as defined in § 4–101 of this title.

subparagraph.text: The State, a local government, or a local health department that provides dental services to the poor, elderly, or disabled:

sub-subparagraph.text: May not be required by the Board to seek authorization under this title to provide the services; and
Shall provide written notice to the Board of its intention to provide dental services to the poor, elderly, or disabled at least 60 days prior to the date the services are to be provided.

subparagraph.text: A medical emergency plan;
Adequate equipment, including portable equipment where appropriate, and appropriate armamentarium available for the appropriate delivery of dental services; and
Adequate safeguards to protect the health and safety of patients.

subparagraph.text: Enter and inspect a temporary dental clinic in order to carry out a duty under this title; and

Conduct an investigation of a temporary dental clinic or a holder of a temporary volunteer dentist’s license or a temporary volunteer dental hygienist’s license providing dental services at the temporary dental clinic.

paragraph.text: Teach dental hygiene only at the institution named on the license; and
Practice dental hygiene under the general supervision of a licensed dentist with the institution named on the license.

Adequate facilities and equipment are available for the delivery of dental hygiene services other than fluoride rinse programs; and
The facility reports to the Board any changes in the status of the facility’s general supervision, any supervising dentist, or any dental hygienist within 30 days after the change.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, “private dental office” means a dental office owned and operated by:

subparagraph.text: A licensed dentist; or
A professional corporation, partnership, limited liability company, or limited liability partnership owned and controlled by a licensed dentist.

paragraph.text: While it is effective, a general license to practice dental hygiene issued under this title authorizes the licensee to practice dental hygiene under the general supervision of a licensed dentist in a private dental office.
A private dental office in which a dental hygienist is authorized to practice under the general supervision of a licensed dentist shall ensure that:

subparagraph.text: The supervising dentist holds an active license to practice dentistry in this State;
The dental hygienist holds an active license to practice dental hygiene in this State;
The dental hygienist has at least 1,500 hours of dental hygiene clinical practice in direct patient care; and

There is a written agreement between the supervising dentist and the dental hygienist practicing under general supervision that clearly sets forth the terms and conditions under which the dental hygienist may practice, including a statement that the dental hygienist may provide dental hygiene services without the supervising dentist on the premises.

paragraph.text: A dental hygienist may perform authorized dental hygiene services without the supervising dentist on the premises only if:

subparagraph.text: After the supervising dentist examines and evaluates a patient, the prescribed and authorized treatment to be provided by the dental hygienist is written in the patient’s records;

sub-subparagraph.text: Treatments authorized by a supervising dentist to be provided by the dental hygienist are rendered no later than 7 months from the date the patient was examined and evaluated by the supervising dentist; and
Upon expiration of a prescription or prescribed treatment, the supervising dentist examines and reevaluates the patient before writing a new prescription and authorization for treatment;

subparagraph.text: Prior to an appointment, the patient or the custodial parent or legal guardian of a minor or incompetent adult shall:

sub-subparagraph.text: Be informed that a dental hygienist will be providing services previously prescribed by a dentist who will not be on the premises during the appointment; and
Consent to receiving the dental hygiene services;

subparagraph.text: Written emergency procedures are in place and the dental hygienist is trained to implement the emergency procedures;
A designated licensed dentist is available for consultation with the dental hygienist; and

The number of unsupervised clinical hours worked by a supervised dental hygienist in any given 3–month period is less than 60 percent of the dental hygienist’s total hours worked during that 3–month period.

paragraph.text: A supervising dentist may not employ more than two dental hygienists to work under the dentist’s general supervision at any given time.

Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, a license expires on the date set by the Board, unless the license is renewed for an additional term as provided in this section. A license may not be renewed for a term longer than 2 years.
Except as provided in § 4-303.1 of this subtitle, a limited license to practice dentistry expires on the first anniversary of its effective date.
A teacher’s license to practice dentistry or a teacher’s license to practice dental hygiene expires on the earlier of:

subparagraph.text: The date set by the Board, unless the license is renewed for an additional term as provided in this section; or
The date when the licensee ceases to be a full-time or part-time faculty member at the institution named on the license.

subsection.text: If a teacher’s license to practice dentistry expires because the licensee no longer is a full-time or part-time faculty member at the institution named on the license, the licensee shall surrender the license to the Board secretary within 30 days.

paragraph.text: The Board shall place the holder of a general license to practice dentistry or a general license to practice dental hygiene on inactive status and issue an inactive status registration certificate to the licensee, if the licensee:

subparagraph.text: Submits to the Board an application for inactive status on the form required by the Board; and
Pays to the Board the inactive status application fee set by the Board.

paragraph.text: A licensee on inactive status may not practice dentistry or dental hygiene in this State.

subsection.text: The form provided by the Board for inactive status application or renewal shall require the individual to state:

paragraph.text: Name;
Inactive status registration number, if any;
Degree;
School that awarded the degree;
Year of graduation;
Home address;
Principal office address;
Principal office telephone number; and
Whether or not the individual is in regular practice outside this State.

subsection.text: The Board shall waive the examination requirements of §§ 4-302 and 4-305 of this subtitle for:

paragraph.text: A dentist on inactive status who applies for a general license to practice dentistry, if the dentist has practiced dentistry regularly in any other state within 3 years of applying for the license; or

A dental hygienist on inactive status who applies for a general license to practice dental hygiene, if the dental hygienist has practiced dental hygiene regularly in any other state within 3 years of applying for the license.

section.text: The Board shall reinstate a general license to practice dentistry, a teacher’s license to practice dentistry, a general license to practice dental hygiene, or a teacher’s license to practice dental hygiene that is expired only if the licensee:

paragraph.text: Meets the renewal and reinstatement requirements set by rule and regulation of the Board; and
Pays to the Board a reinstatement fee set by the Board.

subsection.text: Subject to the provisions of this section, the Board may issue a temporary license to practice dental hygiene to an applicant who:

paragraph.text: Is licensed to practice dental hygiene in any other state or any province of Canada;
Meets any other qualifications that the Board establishes;
Submits to the Board an application on the form that the Board requires;
Has graduated from a dental hygiene program accredited by the American Dental Association Commission on Dental Accreditation; and
Pays to the Board an application fee set by the Board.

subsection.text: While it is effective, a temporary license to practice dental hygiene authorizes the holder to practice dental hygiene subject to the same restrictions imposed on a holder of a general license to practice dental hygiene.

A temporary license to practice dental hygiene expires when licenses are issued to those who pass the first examination for a general license to practice dental hygiene given over 30 days after the effective date of the temporary license.

Each holder of a general license to practice dental hygiene, a teacher’s license to practice dental hygiene, or a temporary license to practice dental hygiene shall display the license and any current renewal certificate conspicuously in the office where the holder is engaged in practice.

Each holder of a general license to practice dentistry, a limited license to practice dentistry, or a teacher’s license to practice dentistry shall keep the license and any current renewal certificate in the office where the holder is engaged in practice.

paragraph.text: Each holder of a general license to practice dentistry, a limited license to practice dentistry, or a teacher’s license to practice dentistry shall notify the secretary of the Board in writing within 60 days of any change of office address.
A licensee who fails to notify the secretary of the Board of any change of office address as provided in this subsection shall pay to the Board a late fee of $10.

subsection.text: If a dentist is engaged in the private practice of dentistry in this State, the dentist shall display the notice developed under § 1-207 of this article conspicuously in the office where the dentist is engaged in practice.

Unless the Board agrees to accept the surrender of a license, a holder of a general license, limited license, teacher’s license, or a temporary license may not surrender the license nor may the license lapse by operation of law while the licensee is under investigation or while charges are pending against the licensee.
The Board may set conditions on its agreement with the licensee under investigation or against whom charges are pending to accept surrender of the license.

Subject to the hearing provisions of § 4–318 of this subtitle, the Board may deny a general license to practice dentistry, a limited license to practice dentistry, or a teacher’s license to practice dentistry to any applicant, reprimand any licensed dentist, place any licensed dentist on probation, or suspend or revoke the license of any licensed dentist, if the applicant or licensee:

paragraph.text: Fraudulently or deceptively obtains or attempts to obtain a license for the applicant or licensee or for another;
Fraudulently or deceptively uses a license;
Obtains a fee by fraud or attempts to obtain a fee by fraud;

Is convicted of or pleads guilty or nolo contendere to a felony or to a crime involving moral turpitude, whether or not any appeal or other proceeding is pending to have the conviction or plea set aside;
Provides professional services while:

subparagraph.text: Under the influence of alcohol; or
